main event: A civilian sighting of a red and yellow light object in the sky over Madera, California on July 25, 1959 at 22:15 local time.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a round, red and yellow light, about the size of half a pea.
The object was first sighted to the southeast, moving northwest, and became brighter at times before fading and disappearing.
The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes.
The object's path was described as straight across the observer's orbit.
The observers were three civilian attorneys, one of whom was a former WWII navigator.
witnesses: three civilian attorneys, one of whom was a former WWII navigator
